definition: sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
border/horizon/shore

sentences.english: Way before the book dry hills and a net is short stunt for porridge.
sentences.chinese: 书山有路先干为净，学海无涯八宝作粥。

sentences.english: Mountain road to the book for the track, learning is endless suffering for the boat.
sentences.chinese: 书山有路勤为径，学海无涯苦作舟。用英语怎么写？

sentences.english: There is a road to Xiangan king, eight porridge for There is no end for learning.
sentences.chinese: 书山有路先干为敬，学海无涯八宝作粥。

sentences.english: There is no end in learning. A lot of efforts are needed for final achievement.
sentences.chinese: 学海无涯苦作舟，想要学业有成必须经过一番努力。

sentences.english: Life is limited, knowledge is oceanic, selective learning is very important.
sentences.chinese: 人生有限，学海无涯，懂得选择性吸取知识至为重要。

sentences.english: With so many things yet to learn, Venus plans to pursue a Master's degree after graduation.
sentences.chinese: 她有感学海无涯，打算继续深造硕士课程。

sentences.english: Learned people know they can never learn enough.
sentences.chinese: 有学识的人知道学海无涯。

definition: no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
sea of learning/erudite/knowledgeable person/scholarship
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
see 行萬里路，讀萬卷書|行万里路，读万卷书[xing2 wan4 li3 lu4 , du2 wan4 juan4 shu1]
pinyin: du2 wan4 juan4 shu1 , xing2 wan4 li3 lu4

definition: if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age
pinyin: shao4 zhuang4 bu4 nu3 li4 , lao3 da4 tu2 shang1 bei1
related.word: 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲

definition: to learn is to know one's ignorance (the Book of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
pinyin: xue2 ran2 hou4 zhi1 bu4 zu2

definition: Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
mastery of study lies in diligence (idiom). You can only master a subject by assiduous study./Excellence in work is only possible with diligence./Practice makes perfect.
a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: study hard and every day you will improve (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 hao3 xue2 xi2 , tian1 tian1 xiang4 shang4

definition: sailing on the sea of learning (idiom)
to search for sth/to seek/to quest/to explore
lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold. (idiom)/fig. free time is to be treasured
pinyin: yi1 cun4 guang1 yin1 yi1 cun4 jin1

definition: one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人

definition: instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
